citeinfo.origin: National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA), Office of Oceanic and Atmospheric Research (OAR), Pacific Marine Environmental Laboratory (PMEL)
citeinfo.title: Ice Conditions in the Eastern Bering Sea from NOAA and LANDSAT Imagery: Winter Conditions 1974, 1976, 1977, 1979

abstract.p: LANDSAT and NOAA satellite images from the University of Alaska LANDSAT Library have been used to make maps of ice conditions in the eastern Bering Sea. The analyses included daily charts of the ice, polynya locations, floe trajectories and comparisons between data taken from the two sources. A Zoom Transfer Scope (ZTS) was used to transfer the data from an image to a map base for late winter conditions in 1974, 1976, 1977 and 1979.

[Reference: McNutt, S.L. (1981): Ice conditions in the Eastern Bering Sea from NOAA and LANDSAT imagery: Winter conditions 1974, 1976, 1977, 1979. NOAA Tech. Memo. ERL PMEL-24 (PB81-220188), 179 pp. ]

descript.purpose: To show the history of ice conditions in the eastern Bering Sea from NOAA and LANDSAT imagery for winter 1974, 1976, 1977, and 1979.

distinfo.distliab: While every effort has been made to ensure that these data are accurate and reliable within the limits of the current state of the art, NOAA cannot assume liability for any damages caused by any errors or omissions in the data, nor as a result of the failure of the data to function on a particular system.
